Feature.Description: Functionality to control and maintain the drive that drives the pump. Allows to initialize a pump (e.g. by executing a reference move) and obtain status information about the pump drive's current state (i.e. enabled/disabled). The initialization has to be successful in order for the pump to work correctly and dose fluids. If the initialization fails, the DefinedExecutionError InitializationFailed is thrown.

Command.Description: Initialize the pump drive (e.g. by executing a reference move).
Set the pump into enabled state.
Set the pump into disabled state.

Restore the internal hardware position counter value of the pump drive. This function is not required and not supported for devices that have an absolute encoder such as the new Nemesys 4 devices Nemesys S and Nemesys M.

Parameter.Description: The position counter value to restore

Property.Description: The current state of the pump. This is either 'Enabled', 'Disabled', or 'Initializing'. Only if the sate is 'Enabled', the pump can dose fluids.
Returns if the pump is in fault state. If the value is true (i.e. the pump is in fault state), it can be cleared by calling EnablePumpDrive.

Returns the value of the internal drive position counter. You can query this value and store it persistently somewhere before shutting down the device and restore it later using the RestoreDrivePositionCounter Command.

DefinedExecutionError.Description: The initialization did not end properly.
There is already another initialization running that hasn't finished yet. Starting a new initialization move is not allowed.
